page.title: 08Midsomer Norton Criterium.
page.content: {CRITERIUM IN NORTON RADSTOCK Thousands of people came out on Wednesday,July 3rd.1985 to watch history being made in Midsomer Norton. For the first time a Criterium was held which is a cycle race around the houses.People applauded as the riders went around the course.It began at High Street then to Church Lane,along North Road and then turned into High Street at Stones Cross.Riders came from all around and the main event lasted for 1.5 hrs..A local bank manager started the race and the riders had to ride for one hour plus 5 laps.They rode approx.56 kilometres. The evening started with a 1 lap race by local paper boys and then the Holcombe Majorettes added a musical break.There were displays of vintage bicycles and other stalls.It was arranged by the Somer Valley Club.
